results.justification: Chapter 1 introduces the research focus and Chapter 3 details the implementation, outlining the approach used for the reproducibility checking pipeline.

Chapter 3 provides a detailed description of the pipeline's implementation, including text extraction, analysis, and evaluation against the checklist. Figure 3.1 and 3.3 visually represent the workflow.

The document describes analyzing LAK proceedings, but does not provide access to the proceedings themselves or the data used for the analysis. It mentions analyzing papers from LAK’21 and LAK’22, but doesn't share the dataset.
Since the data is not shared, a justification is not provided.
No data is shared, therefore no documentation exists.
The document states that papers from LAK conferences were analyzed, and the process of selecting and processing these papers is described.
The document states: 'All code was written in Python 3.13 and is available in the following GitHub repository: https://github.com/domkka/bachelorthesis/tree/main/pythonprototype'
Code is shared, so no justification is needed.
The document states that the code includes scripts for data preparation and analysis.
The study uses quantitative methods to assess reproducibility scores and compare results, and mentions statistical analysis.
While quantitative methods are used, specific effect sizes, confidence intervals, or p-values are not explicitly reported in the provided text.
The human evaluation component involves gathering subjective feedback from researchers, representing qualitative data.
The document describes the survey process and the collection of open-ended responses, indicating attention to subjective context and interpretation.
Chapter 4 presents the results of the study, including figures and tables summarizing the findings from both the automated pipeline and the human evaluation.
Chapter 5 explicitly discusses the limitations of the pipeline and potential biases in the evaluation process.
The document does not mention any preregistration of the study itself.
